poem:
**Forgotten Pop Dreams**

Sequins glint as time rewinds  
Barefoot on the glistening stage  
Belinda sings of yesterdays  
"Who recalls the echoing 80s?"  
Memories unfurl like old songs,  
Age softened by joy and sequined nights  
Mad about you, once —  
And always, in neon whispers  
Of a barefooted muse.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Belinda Carlisle review – gleeful veteran lassoes devoted audience with ageless hits ‘Who remembers the 80s? Good – I don’t!” Cheerful, barefoot and sparkling in sequins, Belinda Carlisle is walking her infatuated audience down memory lane. Each song on this greatest hits tour comes with a timestamp and a story, and right now she’s introducing Mad About You, the 1986 single that transformed her from a member of record-breaking all-female rock band the Go-Go’s into". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
